Course Info: Develop a deeper understanding of artists’ and designers’ processes, including modes of experimentation and responses to technological innovation.Develop critical thinking and looking skills to understand how artists and designers respond to the social and cultural issues of their time.Gain confidence in looking at and talking about modern and contemporary art and design, and find inspiration from art all around you.Better comprehend the choices you make about fashion with respect to expression, identity, and issues such as labor practices and sustainability. Better understand the decisions you make regarding fashion in terms of self-expression, identity, and issues like labor practices and sustainability. Courses include Design, Art, History, Photography, Museums, Modern Art & Ideas, Seeing Through Photographs, What Is Contemporary Art?, and Fashion as Design in the Arts and Humanities.

Course Info Translate: Discussing why one musical recording is more compelling than another involves identifying the unique elements of the recording that contribute to its appeal. It is important to begin assessing and establishing your identity, vision, and intention as an artist and producer. By writing and developing a compelling piece of music using various tools, you can establish the sonic signature of your production through specific production techniques. This course covers topics such as Music, Songwriting, Music production, Audio Production, and Music recording. Welcome to The Art of Music Production, where you will learn about Listening Like A Producer, Identity, Vision, and Intention, Strengthening Musical Productions: Tools & Strategies, and Defining the Sonic Signature of your Song in the Arts and Humanities field.

Course Info: Synthesize typography, imagemaking, composition and systematic thinking skills through ideation, invention, and conceptualizationDemonstrate visual research and development skills through the creation of a Brand Development GuideExpand a brand identity's palette through the inclusion of graphic marks or icons, color, secondary typefaces, and/or images  Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Indesign, Graphics, Color Theory Course Overview, Ideation: Invent Your Client, Visualization: Make Your Fake, Logotype: Brand Your Brand, Palette: Expand Your Brand, Application: Apply Your Brand, Publication: Display Your Brand Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: In this course, you will learn how to combine typography, image creation, composition, and systematic thinking to generate ideas, invent concepts, and conceptualize designs. You will also develop skills in visual research and brand development by creating a Brand Development Guide. Additionally, you will learn how to enhance a brand identity by incorporating graphic marks or icons, color, secondary typefaces, and images. The course will cover topics such as Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, graphics, color theory, ideation, visualization, logotype design, expanding brand palettes, applying brand identities, and displaying brands in publications.

Course Info: How arguments from philosophers and evidence from neuroscientists contribute to the conversation about free will.To deploy these ideas to challenge assumptions of determinism in discussion and debate.How the bridge between behavior and neurobiology, and the links between attention and consciousness build our understanding of our own free will. Philosophy, Critical Thinking, Neuroscience The Basics of Libertarian Free Will, Free Will and Neuroscience, Neural Basis of Imagination, Free Will, and Morality Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: The text discusses how arguments from philosophers and evidence from neuroscientists play a role in the discussion about free will. It also explores how these ideas can be used to challenge assumptions of determinism in debates. The text further delves into the connection between behavior and neurobiology, as well as the relationship between attention and consciousness, in order to deepen our understanding of free will. Topics covered include philosophy, critical thinking, neuroscience, the basics of libertarian free will, the relationship between free will and neuroscience, the neural basis of imagination, and the connection between free will and morality in the arts and humanities.

Course Title: Approaching Music Theory: Melodic Forms and Simple Harmony
Course Info: Analyze the relationship between the technical details and aesthetics of music.Explore how culture, psychology, physics, formal context, and a sense of play all shape musical language.Discover ways in which music theory may be relevant to enjoying, communicating a love for, and performing music.Demonstrate confidence in the kind of musical self-analysis that can help you develop your own musical ideas. Music, Jazz, Music composition, Classical Music, Music theory Course Overview, Melodic Structures: Lines, Shapes, and Simple Modes, Melodic Structures: Simplicity, Repetition, and Change, Combining Pitches: Consonance and Dissonance , Cadences and Basic Harmonic Function Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: In this course, we will analyze the relationship between the technical details and aesthetics of music. We will explore how culture, psychology, physics, formal context, and a sense of play all shape musical language. We will discover ways in which music theory may be relevant to enjoying, communicating a love for, and performing music. We will demonstrate confidence in the kind of musical self-analysis that can help you develop your own musical ideas. Topics covered include Music, Jazz, Music composition, Classical Music, Music theory, Melodic Structures: Lines, Shapes, and Simple Modes, Melodic Structures: Simplicity, Repetition, and Change, Combining Pitches: Consonance and Dissonance, Cadences and Basic Harmonic Function in Arts and Humanities.
Course Title Translate: Approaching Music Theory: Melodic Forms and Simple Harmony

Course Title: 東坡詞 (Ci Poetry of Su Dong Po)
Course Info: Not specified Not specified 課程資訊, 第一講：詞體與人情─東坡填詞的動因及其詞的特質, 第二講：詞情的深化─東坡「淚」與抒情自我的顯現, 第三講： 詞境的開拓─由〈江城子〉到〈水調歌頭〉, 第四講：時空的感喟─由〈永遇樂〉到〈洞仙歌〉, 第五講：文體的抉擇─由〈念奴嬌〉到〈赤壁賦〉, 第六講：行旅的省思─由定風波到定風波, 第七講：詠物與抒情─在物我交感中體證詞情的深度, 第八講：飄蕩與回歸─在人情世界中尋得心靈的安頓 Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: Course information not specified, first lecture: Word style and human emotions - the motivation of Su Dongpo's lyrics and their characteristics, second lecture: Deepening of lyrical emotions - Su Dongpo's "tears" and the manifestation of lyrical self, third lecture: Expansion of lyrical context - from "Jiangchengzi" to "Shuidiao Getou", fourth lecture: Reflection on time and space - from "Yongyu Le" to "Dongxian Ge", fifth lecture: Choice of literary style - from "Nian Nu Jiao" to "Chibi Fu", sixth lecture: Reflection on travel - from "Ding Feng Bo" to "Ding Feng Bo", seventh lecture: Describing objects and emotions - demonstrating the depth of lyrical emotions through the interaction between objects and self, eighth lecture: Drifting and returning - finding spiritual settlement in the world of human emotions. Arts and Humanities.

Course Title: Antisemitism: From Its Origins to the Present
Course Info: To  discuss what antisemitism is and what is unique about it  To explain the historical and ideological roots of antisemitism and how it has developed  To discuss the characteristics of antisemitism today  To identify antisemitic language and actions in the past and in the present   Not specified WHAT IS ANTISEMITISM? DEFINITIONS AND ORIGINS, THE CHANGING FACE OF ANTISEMITISM, GENOCIDAL ANTISEMITISM: FROM WORLD WAR I TO THE HOLOCAUST, CONTEMPORARY ANTISEMITISM, THE ISLAMIC AND ARAB WORLD, ADDRESSING ANTISEMITISM Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: The text discusses the definition and origins of antisemitism, the historical and ideological roots of antisemitism, its development over time, the characteristics of antisemitism today, and the identification of antisemitic language and actions in the past and present. Specific topics include the changing face of antisemitism, genocidal antisemitism from World War I to the Holocaust, contemporary antisemitism, antisemitism in the Islamic and Arab world, and addressing antisemitism in the arts and humanities.
Course Title Translate: Antisemitism: From Its Origins to the Present

Course Title: Modern Hebrew Poetry   שירה עברית מודרנית
Course Info: Not specified tracing its evolution from the Enlightenment period to the present day., Mapping the development of modern Hebrew poetry: The course offers a comprehensive overview of modern Hebrew poetry, Analysis of poetic elements: The course delves into the poetic aspects of Hebrew poetry, examining the stylistic and thematic developments within the field., Historical understanding: The course incorporates a rich historical perspective Week 1 - Introduction to the Hebrew Renaissance, Week 2 - The Renaissance, Week 3 - Bialik 1 - Sentimental Education, Week 4 - Bialik 2 - Light, Shade and Wrath, "Week 5 - Bialiks Generation - Belle Époque and Urbanism", Week 6 - Pioneers of Modernism, Week 7 - On The Verge of Expressionism, Week 8 - Modernism and Symbolism, Week 9 - The Women Pioneers of Poetry, Week 10 - The Poetry of Alterman, Week 11 - Goldberg and Lenski, Week 12 - The Generation of 1948, Week 13 - The Generation of the State, Week 14 - Israeli Poetry and the Spoken Hebrew Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: The course traces the evolution of modern Hebrew poetry from the Enlightenment period to the present day. It offers a comprehensive overview of modern Hebrew poetry, analyzing its poetic elements and examining stylistic and thematic developments. The course also incorporates a rich historical perspective, with topics including the Hebrew Renaissance, Bialik's works, pioneers of modernism, women pioneers of poetry, and Israeli poetry in the context of the spoken Hebrew arts and humanities.

Course Info Translate: Not specified. Course introduction. Lecture 1: A brief history of Kunqu opera performance (Professor Wang Anqi). Lecture 2: The background of late Ming Kunqu opera development and "The Peony Pavilion" (Professors Zheng Peikai and Hua Wei). Lecture 3: The artistic conception of Kunqu opera lyrical poetry (Professor Pai Hsien-yung). Lecture 4: Kunqu opera music and singing art (Professors Zhou Qin and Zhang Lizhen). Lecture 5: Kunqu opera performance art: male roles and minor male roles (Ms. Yue Meiti). Lecture 6: Kunqu opera performance art: major male roles and poor male roles (Mr. Cai Zhengren). Lecture 7: Kunqu opera performance art: female roles and main female roles (Ms. Zhang Jiqing and Ms. Zhang Jingxian). Lecture 8: Kunqu opera performance art: supporting female roles, unconventional female roles, and martial female roles (Teachers Liang Guyin and Wang Zhiquan). Lecture 9: Kunqu opera performance art: painted faces and martial characters fusion (Mr. Hou Shaokui). Lecture 10: Kunqu opera final performance art (Mr. Ji Zhenhua). Course Title: Odesa: Jews in the Modern World
Course Info: Describe the connection between Odesa as a place of opportunity and abundance, international trade, and modern capitalism.Connect virtuosity with Jewish interculturality and the complications of multilingual cultural production .Describe the ambiguous class and economic status of Jews in the Russian Empire and Pale of Settlement. Not specified Lecture 1: A city like no other, Lecture 2: Jewish life in the Russian Empire, Lecture 3: Modernism & Internationalism, Lecture 4: Antisemitism in the Russian Empire, Lecture 5: Jewish achievement in the modern world, Lecture 6: Jewish virtuosity, Lecture 7: Revolution & Civil War, Final Project: A Postcard from Odesa Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: The connection between Odesa as a place of opportunity and abundance, international trade, and modern capitalism is described. The text also discusses the link between virtuosity and Jewish interculturality, as well as the complications of multilingual cultural production. The ambiguous class and economic status of Jews in the Russian Empire and Pale of Settlement are also explored. The lecture topics include: A city like no other, Jewish life in the Russian Empire, Modernism & Internationalism, Antisemitism in the Russian Empire, Jewish achievement in the modern world, Jewish virtuosity, Revolution & Civil War, and the Final Project: A Postcard from Odesa Arts and Humanities.
Course Title Translate: Odesa: Jews in the Modern World

Course Title: El Holocausto: el abismo de la humanidad
Course Info: Ahondaremos en la vida de los judíos entreguerras, el antisemitismo moderno, la ideología nazi y las persecuciones contra los judíos en toda EuropaPresentaremos  el desarrollo de la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Presentaremos el desarollo de la “Solución final a la cuestión judía”    Expondremos la inmigración de sobrevivientes a América Latina. Debatir sobre la memoria y la conmemoración en América Latina y España Presentaremos talleres decuativos listos para aplicar en el aula Not specified La vida judía antes del Holocausto y el ascenso del partido nazi al poder, El estallido de la Segunda Guerra Mundial y la guetoización, La "Solucion final" y el fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, América Latina y el Holocausto, Enseñando el Holocausto Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: We will delve into the life of Jews between the wars, modern antisemitism, Nazi ideology, and persecutions against Jews throughout Europe. We will present the development of the Second World War. We will present the development of the "Final Solution to the Jewish Question." We will discuss the immigration of survivors to Latin America. We will debate about memory and commemoration in Latin America and Spain. We will present educational workshops ready to be applied in the classroom. Topics include: Jewish life before the Holocaust and the rise of the Nazi party to power, the outbreak of the Second World War and ghettoization, the "Final Solution" and the end of the Second World War, Latin America and the Holocaust, Teaching the Holocaust in Arts and Humanities.
Course Title Translate: The Holocaust: the abyss of humanity

Course Title: 中國園林文學 (一) (Chinese Garden Literature (1))
Course Info: 認識中國古典文人園林的審美特質及文化投影。增進中國園林文學的解讀能力，詮釋與思索前人的存在經驗。關懷自己與存在空間的關係，培養深入體察及審美創新的能力。 Not specified 導論：走向文人園林, 導論：文學書寫與人地關係, 前行者的身影：陶淵明的歸返田園, 前行者的身影：王維的棲遊輞川, 漂泊：杜甫人生方向的追尋與修正, 止歇：杜甫浣花草堂倫理關係的重構, 出走蟻壤：白居易廬山草堂的心 / 境對話, 壺中天地：白居易履道宅園的江南風景, 期末評量 Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: Understanding the aesthetic characteristics and cultural projection of classical Chinese literati gardens. Enhancing the ability to interpret Chinese garden literature, interpreting and reflecting on the experiences of past scholars. Caring for the relationship between oneself and the space of existence, cultivating the ability to deeply observe and innovate aesthetically. Introduction: Towards literati gardens, Introduction: Literary writing and human-environment relationships, The figure of the predecessor: Tao Yuanming's return to the countryside, The figure of the predecessor: Wang Wei's dwelling in the Wang River, Drifting: Du Fu's pursuit and correction of life direction, Resting: Du Fu's reconstruction of ethical relationships at the Huanhua Cottage, Leaving the anthill: Bai Juyi's dialogue between heart and environment at the Lushan Cottage, Heaven and Earth in a pot: Bai Juyi's Jiangnan landscape at the Lüdao Mansion, Final assessment Arts and Humanities.

Course Title: 東亞儒學：孟子一(East Asian Confucianisms: Mencius (1))
Course Info: Not specified Not specified 第 1 講 孔子及其思想遺產, 第 2 講 歷史變局中孟子的人格與風格, 第 3 講 孟子的思維方式與傳統中華文化的價值理念, 第 4 講 孟子思想中的生命觀與身體觀：從「六氣」到「浩然之氣」的轉化, 第 5 講 孟子的政治思想：王道政治的理想及其背叛,  第 6 講 孟子理想中的「公」與「私」「理」之衝突問題及其解消, 第 7 講 孟子的教育思想：「心靈的覺醒」及其在全球化時代的新啟示 Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: Not specified. Lecture 1: Confucius and his legacy of thought. Lecture 2: The personality and style of Mencius in the historical context. Lecture 3: Mencius' way of thinking and the values of traditional Chinese culture. Lecture 4: Mencius' views on life and the body: the transformation from "six energies" to "great spirit." Lecture 5: Mencius' political thought: the ideal of the Way of Kings and its betrayal. Lecture 6: The conflict between "public" and "private" in Mencius' ideals and its resolution. Lecture 7: Mencius' educational thought: the awakening of the mind and its new revelations in the era of globalization. Arts and Humanities.

Course Title: L’antisémitisme : De ses origines à nos jours

DÉFINITIONS ET ORIGINES, LES ÉVOLUTIONS DE L’ANTISÉMITISME, L’ANTISÉMITISME GÉNOCIDAIRE: DE LA PREMIÈRE GUERRE MONDIALE À L’HOLOCAUSTE, L’ANTISÉMITISME CONTEMPORAIN, LE MONDE ISLAMIQUE ET ARABE, ABORDER L’ANTISÉMITISME Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: Debating what antisemitism is and what makes it unique. Explaining the historical and ideological roots of antisemitism and how it has developed. Identifying antisemitic language and actions in the past and present. Discussing the characteristics of antisemitism today. Not specified WHAT IS ANTISEMITISM? DEFINITIONS AND ORIGINS, THE EVOLUTION OF ANTISEMITISM, GENOCIDAL ANTISEMITISM: FROM WORLD WAR I TO THE HOLOCAUST, CONTEMPORARY ANTISEMITISM, THE ISLAMIC AND ARAB WORLD, ADDRESSING ANTISEMITISM. Arts and Humanities.

Course Title: 中國園林文學 (二) (Chinese Garden Literature (2))
Course Info: 認識中國古典文人園林的審美特質及文化投影。增進中國園林文學的解讀能力，詮釋與思索前人的存在經驗。關懷自己與存在空間的關係，培養深入體察及審美創新的能力。 Not specified 蘇舜欽的人生際遇, 清風明月本無價的滄浪亭\x0b, 滄浪亭的歷史記憶, 祁彪佳與寓山的逢會, 寓山園林的景象與生活, 體現主體價值的寓山, 西湖上的園舟與舟園, 不繫園的多重身分, 不繫園的文化意義, 「中國園林文學 (二)」期末評量 Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: Understanding the aesthetic characteristics and cultural implications of classical Chinese literati gardens. Enhancing the ability to interpret Chinese garden literature, interpreting and reflecting on the experiences of past scholars. Caring for the relationship between oneself and the space of existence, cultivating the ability to deeply observe and innovate aesthetically. Not specified Su Shunqin's life experiences, the priceless Canglang Pavilion of Qingfeng Mingyue, the historical memory of Canglang Pavilion, the meeting of Qi Biaojia and Yushan, the scenery and life of Yushan Garden, embodying the subjective value of Yushan, the garden boats and boat gardens on West Lake, the multiple identities of Buxi Garden, the cultural significance of Buxi Garden, "Chinese Garden Literature (II)" final assessment Arts and Humanities.

Course Title: 又見大觀：《紅樓夢》中的烏托邦 (The Red Chamber Dream (3): Daguan Garden)
Course Info: 本課程旨在使學習者能理解並敘述「大觀園」此一空間場域內的各種規畫和設計所蘊含的象徵寓義。 紅樓夢, 烏托邦, 大觀園 大觀園總論, 大觀園的基址與象徵寓意, 先入園者及園中花魂, 大觀園的水流設計, 大觀園山石設計的象徵寓意, 大觀園重要建築的命名過程, 大觀園空間配置的象徵寓意, 大觀園屋舍內部設計的象徵寓意, 大觀園裏的動物象徵, 大觀園裏的植物象徵 Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: This course aims to enable learners to understand and describe the symbolic meanings contained in the various planning and designs within the space of "The Grand View Garden". Dream of the Red Chamber, Utopia, The Grand View Garden, Overview of The Grand View Garden, The foundation and symbolic meanings of The Grand View Garden, First-time visitors and flower spirits in the garden, The water flow design of The Grand View Garden, The symbolic meanings of the mountain and rock design in The Grand View Garden, The naming process of important buildings in The Grand View Garden, The symbolic meanings of the spatial configuration in The Grand View Garden, The symbolic meanings of the interior design of the houses in The Grand View Garden, Animal symbolism in The Grand View Garden, Plant symbolism in The Grand View Garden. Arts and Humanities.
Course Title Translate: Another View of Daguan Garden: The Utopia in "Dream of the Red Chamber"

Course Title: 深扣孔孟 (An Inquiry into Confucius and Mencius)
Course Info: 本課程教學目標，旨在使學習者者能深入理解、辨析及涵詠孔孟思想的精華要義，期望處於 21 世紀學習者，能從孔孟儒家思想中提煉出日常生活的智慧。 孟子, 自我, 21 世紀, 孔子, 他者 人應如何學習？學習的目標是什麼？, 「自我」是什麼？人應如何轉化「自我」？, 人應如何思考婚姻及家庭？, 在 21 世紀如何治理國家？如何安立合理的政治體制？, 在 21 世紀「政治認同」與「文化認同」張力中如何抉擇？, 在 21 世紀全球化時代中，如何維持友誼？「自我」與「他者」如何互動？, 在 21 世紀「自由」與「秩序」的張力之中，人應如何安立生命？, 人如何面對死亡？ Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: The teaching objectives of this course aim to enable learners to deeply understand, analyze, and appreciate the essence of Confucianism and Mencius' thoughts. It is hoped that learners in the 21st century can extract wisdom from Confucianism and Mencius' thoughts for their daily lives. How should people learn from Confucius and Mencius? What is the goal of learning? What is the "self"? How should people transform the "self"? How should people think about marriage and family? How should a country be governed in the 21st century? How can a reasonable political system be established? How should one choose between "political identity" and "cultural identity" in the tension of the 21st century? How can friendships be maintained in the era of globalization in the 21st century? How should the "self" and the "other" interact? In the tension between "freedom" and "order" in the 21st century, how should people live their lives? How should people face death? Arts and Humanities.
Course Title Translate: Deep Inquiry into Confucius and Mencius

Course Info Translate: Not specified Not specified Lecture 8: Wisdom of Life in the Dao De Jing, Lecture 9: Wisdom of Life in Zen Buddhism, Lecture 10: Life View in the Heart Sutra, Lecture 11: Zhu Xi's Humanistic Spirit (1): The Concept of "Unity in Diversity", Lecture 12: Zhu Xi's Humanistic Spirit (2): The Concept of "Benevolence" and its Influence in Japan and Korea, Lecture 13: Discourse on Benevolent Governance in East Asian Confucian Political Thought and its Theoretical Issues, Lecture 14: Confucian Humanistic Spirit in Chinese Historiography Tradition, Lecture 15: Confucian Humanistic Tradition in Modern Taiwan: Development and Issues, Lecture 16: Conclusion - Core Values of East Asian Confucian Humanistic Spirit Arts and Humanities.

Course Info: Not specified Not specified 你真的准备好了么？先确定你不是叶公好龙哦？, 结合项目开脑洞实例：新叙事手法和叙事角度, 好剧本是改出来的：修改剧本、文本阐释, 前期准备：让所有人心中都有基本一致的影片雏形, 拍摄进行时：他们的经验，助力你的体验, 剪辑进行时：时而是对素材一无所知的“观众”、时而是谋划全盘的编剧, 剪完了发现素材不够？素材不满意？好！补拍, 出片啦！此刻的我百感交集，让我反思总结一下！ Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: Not specified Not specified Are you really ready? Make sure you're not just pretending to be interested! Combining project brainstorming examples: new narrative techniques and narrative perspectives, a good script is made through revisions: modifying scripts, interpreting texts, pre-production preparation: ensuring everyone has a basic consensus on the film's outline, filming in progress: their experiences, helping to enhance your own experience, editing in progress: sometimes a clueless "audience" of the material, sometimes a strategic screenwriter, finished editing and found the material lacking? Not satisfied with the material? Great! Re-shoot, the film is out! At this moment, I am filled with mixed emotions, let me reflect and summarize! Arts and Humanities

Course Title: Musician’s Professional Toolbox: Your Portfolio Career Specialization
Course Info: How to articulate your purpose as a musician in a professional mission statement and develop a personal brand and social media strategy.How to assemble a portfolio of promotional materials, including a professional biography, headshot and resume/CV.How to build tools for networking and task management.How to create a visual representation of your intermediate and long-term career goals to help keep you on track and assess your progress. Task Management, Resume writing, Networking, Marketing, Branding Strategies for Success in your Music Career, Building Your Artistic Brand, Promotional Materials Every Musician Needs, Launching Your Music Career Arts and Humanities
Course Info Translate: In this course, you will learn how to clearly define your purpose as a musician in a professional mission statement and establish a personal brand and social media strategy. You will also learn how to put together a portfolio of promotional materials, such as a professional biography, headshot, and resume/CV. Additionally, you will learn how to create tools for networking and task management, as well as how to visually represent your intermediate and long-term career goals to stay on track and track your progress. This course covers task management, resume writing, networking, marketing, branding strategies for success in your music career, building your artistic brand, promotional materials every musician needs, and launching your music career in the arts and humanities field.
Course Title Translate: Musician’s Professional Toolbox: Your Portfolio Career Specialization

Course Title: Valuing nature and people to inform business decision-making
Course Info: Why it is important to include nature, people and society in business decision-makingHow businesses impact and depend on natural, human and social capital and how that translates into risks and opportunities.How to get started with a capitals assessment.The course helps you to understand how to drive change at the organizational level and teaches you what you can do to make a difference as individual Risk Management, Business Communication, Innovative and strategic thinking, Problem Solving, Stakeholder Engagement The Role of Businesses in Addressing the Great Challenges of Nature Loss, Climate Change and Inequality, Better Managing Risks and Opportunities by Adopting a Capitals Approach, Getting Started with a Natural Capital Assessment: Defining the Objective and Determining the Appropriate Scope, Measuring and Valuing Impacts and Dependencies to Integrate Natural Capital in Decision-Making Business
Course Info Translate: It is important to include nature, people, and society in business decision-making because businesses impact and depend on natural, human, and social capital. This translates into risks and opportunities. To get started with a capitals assessment, the course helps you understand how to drive change at the organizational level and teaches you what you can do to make a difference as an individual. Topics covered include risk management, business communication, innovative and strategic thinking, problem-solving, and stakeholder engagement. The role of businesses in addressing the great challenges of nature loss, climate change, and inequality is also discussed, as well as better managing risks and opportunities by adopting a capitals approach. Getting started with a natural capital assessment involves defining the objective and determining the appropriate scope, as well as measuring and valuing impacts and dependencies to integrate natural capital in decision-making in business.
Course Title Translate: Valuing nature and people to inform business decision-making
